description: An overview of the evolution of Latin American societies since 1750, this course examines the
consequences of independence, 19th-century economic imperialism, and 20th-century
transitions to more urbanized, industrialized ways of life.  Students examine major Latin American
nations and compare their revolutionary and counter-revolutionary trajectories toward the
establishment of authoritarian states.  Foreign Language Across the Curriculum course available
in Spanish.  Offered most years. Counts toward Latin American studies major and concentration.
